title: (x) Italic heading script on ExoStudios website - Goudy {Patricia}
content:
The one used in the headings all over [this site](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415062345/http:/www.exostudios.co.uk/).

For the life of me I can't put my finger on it ... but I know someone here will spot it first glance and I'll be terribly embarassed :)

Thanks in advance all!
author: Jordan Harper

comments.content: Goudy? But maybe with a stroke added - as it's heavier than the regular and lighter than the bold. I can't find a semi-bold.

Goudy looks like a good choice Patty. I think adding (or subtracting) stroke thickness from either of those would give you an intermediate weight. The outlining method also changes the look somewhat.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks for the input guys ... I can't find a cut of Goudy that it looks anything like though! Links?

Now I've said that, I've found [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415062345/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/goudy/t-medium-italic/index.html) that looks like it may be a good match after a bit of stroking...
I think they stroked the regular, rather than using the medium.
